title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: India’s electronics exports soar 47% in Q1FY26
items.summary:
- *India's electronics exports increased by 47%* to $12.4 billion (~₹1.09 lakh crore) in Q1FY26, driven mainly by mobile phones.
- The *mobile phone segment* grew by 55%, with non-mobile categories like solar modules also seeing significant growth.
- Experts highlight the need to *expand non-mobile segments* and build a *resilient, value-added supply chain* for long-term competitiveness.

items.title: TRUMPF Opens First Manufacturing Plant in Pune, India
items.summary:
*TRUMPF*, a global leader in *industrial machine tools* and *laser technology*, has inaugurated its first *manufacturing facility in India* at Pune.
- The factory will initially produce the *TruBend 1000 series*, with plans to localize the *TruLaser 1000 series* by 2025, aiming to boost India’s manufacturing sector.
- TRUMPF has invested over €5 million in India, highlighting its commitment to making India a *global manufacturing hub* and improving supply chain responsiveness.*

items.title: Ammann India launches ABG Paver and new warehouse
items.summary:
- *Ammann India* has started production of its first *tracked asphalt paver* at its Gujarat facility, marking the integration of the ABG Paver business.
- The company also launched a dedicated *warehouse* to support *parts, service*, and *future expansion*, enhancing its aftersales and logistics capabilities.
- This development aims to boost *local manufacturing and export* for both *domestic* and *international markets*, focusing on *emissions-compliant* and adaptable pavers for multiple regions.

items.title: Autodesk launches local data storage in India
items.summary:
- *Autodesk* now offers **local data storage** options for Indian businesses, enhancing data control and compliance.
- The initiative is supported by **AWS** and aims to address security concerns, especially in regulated sectors.
- This move is part of Autodesk’s global effort to provide **regional data solutions**, supporting India’s digital transformation journey.

items.title: Private sector may get SOPs in lagging states for Manufacturing Mission
items.summary:
*The Indian government plans to incentivize the private sector* for establishing manufacturing units in lagging states, aligned with the **National Manufacturing Mission** blueprint.

*Targets include increasing manufacturing's GDP share to 25% by 2047*, with a focus on frontier tech and MSMEs, through policy support and strategic interventions.

*The mission emphasizes **public-private partnerships** and a dedicated oversight body* to ensure progress, aiming to integrate India into global manufacturing value chains.

items.title: Oyster Renewables to Invest ₹16,000 Crore in 2 GW by 2028
items.summary:
*Oyster Renewables plans a ₹16,000 crore investment to expand its renewable energy capacity to 2 GW in India by 2028.*
- The company aims to commission 750 MW of capacity by end-2025, with ongoing projects under development.
- They also plan to introduce a battery storage system and leverage AI and robotics for operational efficiency, contributing notably to India's renewable targets.

**Scores:** {"scale": 6, "impact": 7, "novelty": 5, "longTermSignificance": 7}
**Keywords:** [Renewable Energy, India, Investment, Solar, Wind, Storage]

items.title: ZF Group expands into Indian powertrain market
items.summary:
- *ZF Group* secured major *test system orders* in India, marking its entry into the *powertrain* and *next-gen mobility* sectors.
- Notably, it delivered India's first *440 KW differential unit test bench*, featuring a *3E dyno setup* for enhanced efficiency.
- ZF also acquired orders for *eight tyre test benches* for Indian tyre manufacturers, supporting *improved quality and safety* in automotive components.

items.title: Honeywell & Stereolabs launch logistics measurement tool
items.summary:
- *Honeywell* and *Stereolabs* have developed a **mobile logistics measurement** system using AI and 3D vision.
- The solution enables real-time data capture of size, volume, and weight of boxes and pallets, replacing manual processes.
- Integrating stereoscopic cameras with Honeywell's barcode software, it streamlines **warehouse operations** and improves **transport efficiency**.

**Scores:** {"scale": 6, "impact": 7, "novelty": 8, "longTermSignificance": 7} 
**Keywords:** [logistics, AI perception, warehouse management, 3D vision, supply chain, mobile measurement]

items.title: Reliance Industries warns geopolitical tensions, tariffs may threaten global trade
Tata AutoComp expands EU presence with IAC Slovakia acquisition
items.summary:
- *Tata AutoComp*, part of the Tata Group, is acquiring 100% stakes in *IAC Group Slovakia*, strengthening its position in the *European automotive interior systems market*.
- The deal, pending regulatory approval, aims to *enhance global OEM service*, expand capabilities, and support long-term growth in the UK and EU.
- Leaders highlight the **strategic importance**, emphasizing **synergies**, **faster integration**, and **new partnership opportunities** to bolster Tata AutoComp's international footprint.

items.title: 50% Trump tariffs: Here’s how India can flip the script on Trump’s trade offensive
Trump announces $100B investment by Apple in US manufacturing
items.summary:
*Apple commits to investing an additional $100 billion in US manufacturing over four years* as part of the *American Manufacturing Program*, aiming to boost domestic supply chains. 
- The investment includes collaborations with companies like Corning, Texas Instruments, and Broadcom, but *not a full domestic production of iPhones*.
- The move reflects a desire to increase US manufacturing, amid ongoing trade tensions, and has positively impacted Apple's stock price, despite its recent overall decline.

items.title: US tariffs: Impact on India's sectors and economy
items.summary:
- *US imposes higher tariffs* (up to 50%) affecting India's *labour-intensive sectors* and manufacturing.
- Experts warn this could lead to *slower GDP growth*, increased *import costs*, and downward pressure on the *rupee*.
- *Sectors like textiles, gems, jewelry*, and footwear are particularly vulnerable, with potential long-term economic impacts.

items.title: India hits back at US tariff hike, PM Modi says nation will not compromise on farmers’ interests
Power plants cut coal purchases as use declines
items.summary: *Indian power plants are drawing down record coal inventories and reducing purchases from Coal India*, despite rising electricity demand.

items.title: Japan Explores Shipbuilding Opportunities in India
items.summary:
- *JSMEA* (Japan Ship Machinery and Equipment Association) is exploring *maritime collaboration* with India, including a **business-matching event**.
- The association, with over 256 corporate members, specializes in *marine propulsion engines* and *ship machinery*, promoting *Japanese maritime technology*. 
- This initiative aligns with India's efforts to boost its *shipbuilding industry* through fiscal incentives and *international cooperation*.
keywords: Japan Ship Machinery and Equipment Association

items.title: Carmakers face fines for emission violations in India
items.summary:
*The Indian government is implementing new rules empowering the Bureau of Energy Efficiency (BEE) to impose fines on automakers for emission norm violations.*

- *Under the draft Energy Conservation (Compliance Enforcement) Rules, 2025, penalties will be based on shortfalls in fuel efficiency targets.*
- *Automakers like Kia, Renault, and Mahindra & Mahindra could face penalties of around ₹7,300 crore due to exceeding emission levels in FY23.*

items.title: Tata Steel launches galvanised coils at Kalinganagar
items.summary:
- *Tata Steel* has introduced its first batch of **galvanised coils** from a newly operational line at its *Kalinganagar* plant.
- The **₹27,000 crore Phase II expansion** increased capacity from 3 to 8 MTPA, boosting steel production.
- The **Advanced Galvanising Line-1** features modern technologies to produce high-quality, corrosion-resistant steel for *automotive* and *appliances* sectors, emphasizing quality and surface finish.

items.title: Jindal Stainless MD urges anti-dumping duty
items.summary: *Jindal Stainless* emphasizes the need for an *anti-dumping duty* to protect India's *domestic stainless steel* industry amid *global trade uncertainties* and US tariffs. The company reported a positive financial quarter with increased profits and revenue. *Imports* from countries like *China* and *South Korea* challenge local producers, while export prospects face uncertain prospects due to geopolitical tensions.

items.title: Stricter rules likely to curb substandard steel imports
items.summary:
- *India plans to tighten* advance authorization norms to prevent *import of substandard steel*.
- The government aims to reduce *duty-free imports* of non-BIS compliant steel often sold domestically for export benefit.
- Fitch Ratings predicts *higher safeguard duties* and stricter *non-tariff measures* to protect India's *steel industry* amid global challenges.

items.title: BorgWarner secures hybrid SUV turbo contract in Asia
items.summary:
- *BorgWarner* has signed a contract with a major *East Asian OEM* to supply *turbochargers* for hybrid SUVs.
- The program involves *wastegate turbocharger systems* aimed at enhancing *fuel efficiency*, *performance*, and *drivability*.
- Production will start in *2027* at BorgWarner's facility in Korea, supporting *localization* and *supply chain* efficiency, continuing an *18-year partnership*.

items.title: Bajaj Auto avoids EV production halt, enters e-rickshaw market; Q1 net up 5%
CreditAccess Grameen uses Mendix to boost efficiency
items.summary:
*CreditAccess Grameen*, a major microfinance institution in India, partnered with *Mendix* to accelerate their *digital transformation*.
- They developed a *custom branch auditing app* reducing audit cycles from 45 to 38 days, supporting their expansion.
- The initiative aims to digitize multiple processes across 2,000+ branches, improving operational efficiency and responsiveness.

{"scale":7,"impact":8,"novelty":6,"longTermSignificance":8,"keywords":["Microfinance","Digital Transformation","Automation","India","Operational Efficiency"]}

items.title: Skyroot Aerospace adopts Polarion for software management
items.summary:
- *Skyroot Aerospace*, an Indian space-tech startup, has adopted *Siemens Polarion* to streamline software development.
- This move supports Skyroot's *digital transformation*, enhancing collaboration, traceability, and compliance.
- The company is advancing its mission with innovative space launches like Vikram-1, aiming for affordable, on-demand spaceflight.

**Scores:** { "scale": 7, "impact": 8, "novelty": 6, "longTermSignificance": 8 }

items.title: Addverb uses Siemens Xcelerator to boost factory automation
items.summary: *Addverb Technologies*, an Indian robotics and warehouse automation company, adopts Siemens Xcelerator tools to enhance development and operations. *Key implementations* include Siemens' Teamcenter for product management and Tecnomatix Plant Simulation for virtual modeling of manufacturing systems. *The integration* enables digital twins, proactive maintenance, and faster innovation, driving toward smarter, more agile factories.

items.title: Hindmetal Uses Electromagnetic Tech for Mineral Exploration
items.summary: *Hindmetal Exploration Services* has become the first Indian company to deploy advanced **electromagnetic (EM) technologies** for mineral exploration, including Borehole EM and SQUID sensors. *These tools* enable precise detection of subsurface ore deposits and low-conductivity minerals. *The company also uses drone-based LiDAR and hyperspectral imaging* to explore new and existing mining regions, emphasizing a **data-driven, innovative approach** to resource discovery with lasting strategic benefits.

items.title: NASA's Nuclear Reactors for Moon and Mars
items.summary:
- *NASA aims* to deploy *nuclear power reactors* on the Moon and Mars by the end of the decade. 
- The effort includes appointing a *nuclear power czar* and competing with *China-Russia* joint missions.* 
- *Nuclear energy* offers continuous power, crucial for long-term *human exploration* and activities like *life support* and *mining* on other celestial bodies.

items.title: US to initially impose 'small tariff' on pharma imports, Trump says
Intel Faces Manufacturing Challenges for Next-Gen Chips
items.summary:
- *Intel's* new *18A process* encounters significant *quality hurdles*, affecting yield and production plans. 
- Despite billions invested and an ambitious timeline, *defects* and *complexities* in fabricating advanced chips hinder progress. 
- Success depends on improving *yields*, with Intel relying partly on *TSMC* and aiming for high-volume manufacturing by 2025.

items.title: Bharat Forge's Q1 FY26 Profit Despite Export Challenges
items.summary:
- *Bharat Forge* reported a standalone *PAT of ₹339 crore* in Q1 FY26, driven by domestic and *defense orders*.
- Despite a *12.7% drop in exports*, the company secured new orders worth ₹847 crore, with a *defense order book of ₹9,463 crore*.
- The company anticipates a *challenging FY26* due to *regulatory headwinds* but focuses on *diversification, efficiency,* and supporting *defense growth*.

items.title: Sarla Aviation hires ex-Civil Aviation Secretary
items.summary:
- *Rajiv Bansal*, former Civil Aviation Secretary, joins *Sarla Aviation* as a *regulatory advisor*. 
- He will support *regulatory strategy*, *airworthiness compliance*, and *industry policy* as the company moves towards *commercial deployment*.
- Bansal's appointment marks a key step in *navigating certification processes* and *building India’s aerospace capabilities* for *urban air mobility* and advanced aircraft systems.

items.title: JSW Energy commissions 2nd unit of 240 MW Kutehr hydro project
items.summary:
*JSW Energy has commissioned the second 80 MW unit of its 240 MW Kutehr hydro project in Himachal Pradesh.*
- The project now supplies power to Haryana under a 35-year PPA at Rs 4.50/kWh.
- The company's renewable capacity reaches 7,270 MW, with hydro accounting for 1,551 MW, emphasizing its focus on *renewable energy* expansion.

items.title: Eveready’s BIS-Certified Tefco Plant Boosts Confidence
items.summary:
- *Eveready Industries* received BIS certification for its Lucknow *Tefco plant*, enhancing product quality.
- The certification aims to improve *consumer trust* and address the influx of uncertified, misleading flashlights.
- This move sets a *benchmark* for quality in India’s flashlight market, with all products now carrying the *ISI mark* and *Central Mark License*.

items.title: Govt launches e-commerce export hubs for small exporters
items.summary: *The Indian government invites proposals to establish E-Commerce Export Hubs (ECEHs)* to support *small and medium enterprises* (SMEs), artisans, and small businesses.* These hubs aim to reduce *logistics costs*, streamline *regulatory processes*, and simplify *e-commerce procedures*. Additionally, measures like increased courier export limits, *Dak Ghar Niryat Kendras*, and collaboration with logistics providers enhance export facilitation.* The initiative fosters *cross-border trade*, industry partnerships, and outreach activities to empower small exporters.

items.title: Maruti Suzuki targets Europe for expansion
items.summary:
- *Maruti Suzuki* plans to expand its *European market presence* by aligning models like FRONX, Jimny, and Baleno with local safety and emission standards.
- The company aims to *diversify exports*, especially targeting regions like *Africa, Middle East,* and *Latin America*, reducing reliance on the Indian domestic market.
- This expansion aligns with India's *government's vision* of transforming India into a *global automotive manufacturing and export hub*, bringing in new investments and innovations.

items.title: Calcom partners with RR Kabel for LED manufacturing
items.summary:
- *Calcom Vision*, a Noida-based electronics firm, has entered a partnership with *RR Kabel Limited* to produce *LED lighting products* like bulbs and battens.
- They successfully fulfilled an initial order worth ₹1 crore, with plans to increase production.
- This collaboration enhances Calcom's presence in the *LED industry* and supports its growth through large-scale manufacturing capacity in Greater Noida.

items.title: Hyundai Chennai plant harnesses 20B data points
items.summary:
*Hyundai's Chennai plant generates over 20 billion data points annually using *Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT)*, enabling real-time analytics via 200 dashboards.*
- The company invests in *smart dashboards*, *AI*, *digital twin technology*, and *autonomous robots* to enhance operational agility and reduce downtime.
- Hyundai is committed to sustainability with *88% renewable energy* use, energy-efficient upgrades, and strengthening *local sourcing* for its Indian operations and EV ecosystem.*

items.title: Hyundai’s Talegaon plant to boost annual output
items.summary:
- *Hyundai Motor India* is expanding its *Talegaon* facility in Pune, aiming to increase annual *production capacity* over 1 million units.
- The plant will focus on *SUV* and *EV* manufacturing, emphasizing *lean processes*, *automation*, and *localization*.
- *Engine production* has already begun, with full vehicle assembly expected to elevate total capacity to over *1.07 million units per year*, supporting both *domestic demand* and *exports*.

items.title: India Shortlists 18 R&D Proposals for EV Components
items.summary:
- The Indian government has *shortlisted 18 R&D proposals* to develop electric vehicle (*EV*) subsystems, aiming to boost *domestic manufacturing*. 
- Projects include *wireless chargers, power trains,* and *traction motors*, with a focus on *technology readiness levels* close to commercial production. 
- Proposals are vetted for *industry-academic partnerships*, with funding conditioned on *collaborative development* and *potential for commercialization*.

items.title: RBI Maintains Repo Rate at 5.50%, Neutral Stance
items.summary:
*The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) kept the *repo rate* unchanged at *5.50%*, with a *'neutral'* stance.*
- *The MPC projected *India's GDP growth* at *6.5%* for FY2025-26 and revisited inflation forecasts.*
- *Key policies include maintaining the *Standing Deposit Facility* at *5.25%* and supporting *growth* amid global uncertainties.*

items.title: Alembic Pharma Q1 Net Profit Rises 14%
items.summary:
- *Alembic Pharmaceuticals* reported a **14% increase** in *consolidated net profit* for Q1, reaching ₹154 crore.
- *Revenue* grew to ₹1,717 crore, driven by strong sales in *India* and the *US* markets.
- The company's *India-branded business* grew 5% YoY, and *US generics* sales increased 13%.

items.title: Torrent Electricals to invest over ₹1,000 cr in housing wire segment
items.summary:
- **Torrent Electricals** plans to invest over *₹1,000 crore* to expand its *housing wire* segment, focusing on manufacturing, quality, and branding.
- The company recently launched its products in Gujarat and aims for nationwide growth, driven by rising *power demand* and urbanization.
- India’s **wire and cable market** is projected to grow significantly by 2030, creating opportunities for Torrent's strategic expansion in this sector.

items.title: US market curbs to hit India’s manufacturing ambitions, but domestic demand to stay strong: Moody's
items.summary:
*US President Trump's 25% import duty on India threatens India's manufacturing growth, especially in electronics.*
- *Moody's predicts external restrictions will reduce India's global trade prospects.*
- *Despite this, India’s domestic demand and services sector are expected to remain resilient.*

items.title: Nickel-Copper-PGE Deposits Discovered in Chhattisgarh
items.summary:
- *Deccan Gold Mines Limited* discovered a significant **Nickel-Copper-PGE deposit** in Mahasamund, Chhattisgarh, crucial for **green energy** and high-tech sectors.
- The find includes a **700-meter mineralized zone** in mafic-ultramafic rocks, indicating **substantial mineral potential**.
- This discovery enhances Chhattisgarh's strategic mineral resources and supports the state's **ambitious exploration roadmap** for critical minerals in 2024-25.

items.title: Mercedes-Benz Rolls Out 600,000th G-Class SUV
items.summary:
*Mercedes-Benz has produced its 600,000th G-Class SUV at its Austria plant.*
- The iconic G-Class, launched in 1979, combines **off-road ruggedness** with luxury.
- The latest model, G G 580 with **EQ Technology**, highlights the brand's focus on **sustainable mobility** and customization through the *MANUFAKTUR* program, offering up to 20,000 paint options.

**Impact Score:** 8
**Severity:** 6
**Novelty:** 5
**Long-Term Significance:** 7

items.title: India's Manpower Shortage & Mental Health Crisis
items.summary:
*India faces a severe shortage of trained psychiatrists, psychologists, and mental health specialists.*
- The ratio of psychiatrists in India is only about 0.75 per 100,000 people, far below the WHO recommendation of 1.7.
- Despite increased capacity, mental health workforce gaps, limited seats in postgraduate psychiatry courses, and low numbers of clinical psychologists hinder access to mental health care, amid rising demand and innovative helplines like Tele-MANAS.

**Scores:** {"scale": 7, "impact": 8, "novelty": 6, "longTermSignificance": 8}
**Keywords:** [mental health, psychiatrists, workforce shortage, India, healthcare access, psychology education]

items.title: Bain-owned Jamco reenters business class market amid seat shortage
items.summary:
- *Jamco*, a Japanese aircraft interiors manufacturer owned by *Bain Capital*, is reentering the *business class seat* market amid a global *seat shortage*.
- Bain aims to capitalize on *airline demand* for premium upgrades and retrofit of older aircraft, especially in *first class, business class,* and *premium economy*.
- The company plans to expand globally through acquisitions, despite challenges like *trade tariffs* and *parts shortages* in the aerospace industry, highlighting ongoing *industry recovery* and *investment* opportunities.

items.title: Women Call for Gender‑Responsive Policies to Boost Renewables in India
items.summary:
*Approximately 60% of women in India's energy sector advocate for *gender-responsive policies* to support the goal of 500 GW of renewables by 2030.*
*The report highlights the urgent need for strong policy frameworks to enhance *women's participation* in the sector.*
*Government initiatives like PM Surya Ghar and Green Hydrogen are aimed at increasing *women's engagement* in clean energy transition.*

items.title: Kerala's Neurodiverse-Friendly Coworking Hub Launches
items.summary:
- *Kerala* has inaugurated its first *neurodiversity-friendly coworking space* at Ernakulam, called **'i by Infopark'**.
- The 48,000 sq ft facility can host over *550 professionals* and features flexible workspaces, high-speed internet, security, and amenities tailored to inclusivity.
- The project aims to attract *Global Capability Centres*, support innovation, and serve as a model for expansion across the state.

items.title: L&T’s Rajpura power plant surpasses emission norms
items.summary: *L&T’s Rajpura Thermal Power Plant achieved an emission factor of 0.84 tonne/MWh,* surpassing the national average of 0.97. *The plant's high efficiency is attributed to supercritical technology,* making it a leader among similar units under 800 MW. *Its low auxiliary power consumption reflects operational excellence and potential for even greater emission reductions.*
